articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 35 people in a tent camp in the Gaza city of Rafah, medics said, drawing condemnation from European leaders on Monday who urged implementation of a World Court ruling to halt Israel's offensive.
articles.title: Israeli attack on Rafah tent camp draws global condemnation

articles.author: Cynthia Kim, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea condemned China, Japan and South Korea on Monday for committing to denuclearise the Korean peninsula, describing their joint declaration after a rare summit in Seoul as a "grave political provocation" that violates its sovereignty.
articles.title: North Korea condemns denuclearisation call at neighbours' summit in Seoul

articles.author: Andrew Gray, John Irish
articles.description: The international community is abandoning Syrian refugees as funding to support them in host countries dwindles, Jordan's foreign minister said on Monday ahead of an EU-led donor conference over the 13-year-old war.
articles.title: Ahead of EU meeting, Jordan says Syrian refugees being abandoned

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Unstable terrain, remote locations and damaged roads are hampering relief efforts in Papua New Guinea after more than 670 people were feared killed in a landslide last week in the Pacific nation's north, the United Nations said on Monday.
articles.title: UN says terrain, remote location hamper relief after landslide buries hundreds in PNG

articles.author: Daniela Desantis, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Paraguayan shoppers used to flock in their droves to the border town of Nanawa to buy cheap imports from Argentina, where the weak peso currency for years kept relative prices low for fuel, medicine and groceries smuggled in across the frontier.
articles.title: Argentina's 300% inflation and propped-up peso spawn Paraguay border ghost town

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian military court on Monday refused to release Ivan Popov, the former commander of Russia's 58th army arrested on suspicion of fraud, turning down a request to put him under house arrest, a Reuters reporter in the court said.
articles.title: Russian court keeps General Popov in custody

articles.author: Oliver Griffin
articles.description: Government measures to destroy illegal roads in and around Colombia's Amazon rainforest are stalled, eight sources told Reuters, with one operation suspended altogether over concerns it could set back peace talks between rebels and President Gustavo Petro's administration.
articles.title: Exclusive: Operations to destroy illegal roads in Colombia's Amazon hit standstill, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico's condition after an assassination attempt earlier this month is improving, the government and hospital said on Monday.
articles.title: Slovak prime minister Fico's health improving, government says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's military conducted attack drills deploying about 20 aircraft on Monday including F-35 jets in response to an expected launch of a spy satellite by North Korea, Yonhap news reported.
articles.title: South Korea deploys fighter jets in attack drills, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Panarat Thepgumpanat, Chayut Setboonsarng
articles.description: Courts in Thailand handed jail terms on Monday to an activist musician who set fire to a portrait of the king and to an opposition lawmaker for insulting the monarchy, their lawyers said.
articles.title: Thai courts hand jail terms to lawmaker and musician for royal insults
